query: I dont know why I feel so anxious even when nothing is wrong.

results.document: Tense. Tired. Even on weekends I feel wired.
results.ai_response: That constant tension suggests your system hasn’t really had a chance to rest. When was the last time you felt genuinely relaxed?

results.document: I’m still scared about the future though. Everything feels uncertain.
results.ai_response: Fear of the unknown is universal. When the future feels heavy, grounding in the present — even by naming one thing you control today — can ease that tension.
That suggests a temporary parasympathetic shift.

results.document: That makes sense. But sometimes I just feel empty, like nothing matters.
results.ai_response: That feeling of emptiness can come from emotional burnout. Try reconnecting with small sensory pleasures — smell of coffee, feeling of rain — to anchor yourself in the present.

results.document: I know I should, but it feels fake when I try to be cheerful.
results.ai_response: You don’t have to fake it. Authentic messages like 'I’ve been low lately but thinking of you' can maintain closeness without pressure.
